intro: Parodiodoxa, commonly known as the red-flowered wax plant, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its striking red or pink flowers. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in a fine, waxy coating. Parodiodoxa thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period, which can last several months.
